<a href="style=%22border-bottom:none!important;%22" target="_blank"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning</strong>. During a time of "ok, boomer" and "kids these days," Ruth Bader Ginsburg was the rare figure who was able to cut across the generational divide, inspiring millions of young people through her commitment to equality and her sheer persistence. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And by persistence, we mean her addendum to MLK Jr.'s famous quote: “The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice"...but only "if there is a steadfast commitment to see the task through to completion."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LAW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/19/ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-87?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
RIP RBG
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ruth Bader Ginsburg" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDY2L3J1dGhfYmFkZXJfZ2luc2J1cmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Hume Kennerly/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">She was a presence so towering in our culture she only needed three letters: RBG.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ruth Bader Ginsburg, U.S Supreme Court justice and progressive icon, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/18/us/justice-ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-at-87.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died last night</a> from complications of metastatic pancreatic cancer. She was 87.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a statement, Chief Justice John Roberts said, “Our Nation has lost a jurist of historic stature,” but that “future generations will remember Ruth Bader Ginsburg as we knew her—a tireless and resolute champion of justice.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Some background</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ginsburg was appointed to the country’s highest court in 1993 by President Clinton, but even before that she had built up a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-18/justice-ginsburg-has-died-u-s-supreme-court-says-kf8vp52t?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reputation</a> as a fighter for women’s rights. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>She was the first female tenured professor at Columbia Law school, and as the director of the ACLU’s Women’s Rights Project, RBG argued sex discrimination cases before the very court she would be appointed to later on. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On the business side, Ginsburg was the court’s most aggressive defender of copyright, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-11600472623?mod=hp_lead_pos1&tesla=y&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>. She picked up the interest from her daughter, Jane, an IP expert at Columbia. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Notorious R.B.G.</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In her later years, RBG earned rock-star status among progressives for her fierce commitment to liberal principles. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>You may have seen a few recent films about her: </span><span><a href="https://www.rbgmovie.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>RBG</em></a></span><span> and </span><span><a href="https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4669788/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>On the Basis of Sex</em></a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>She’s been </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2018/05/01/rbg-documentary-shows-how-ruth-bader-ginsburg-became-pop-icon/562930002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">portrayed</a></span><span> in countless memes, t-shirts, and </span><span><em>SNL </em></span><span>skits—can't say the same of most Supreme Court justices. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ginsburg’s death has profound implications for U.S. politics. President Trump and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell will race to add a conservative justice to the court to pad their existing advantage, despite McConnell refusing to consider an Obama Supreme Court nominee in 2016 because it was an election year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In a statement released last night, McConnell said, “President Trump’s nominee will receive a vote on the floor of the United States Senate."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s not what RBG had in mind. In a statement dictated to her granddaughter a few days ago, she said, "My most fervent wish is that I will not be replaced until a new president is installed,” <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/09/18/100306972/justice-ruth-bader-ginsburg-champion-of-gender-equality-dies-at-87?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to NPR</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Ginsburg’s death, while heartbreaking to many Americans, will also serve as a call-to-action 45 days ahead of the election.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/18/tiktok-wechat-set-banned-us-app-stores-sunday-night?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Everyone Downloading TikTok
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Black Friday rush" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11iAbnnYIgFMmQ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Black Friday rush" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/11iAbnnYIgFMmQ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Commerce Department said it will not allow TikTok or WeChat to appear on app stores in the U.S. after 11:59pm on Sunday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>TikTok seemed to be out of the dog house earlier this week when ByteDance accepted <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/oracletiktok-deal-partnership-less-sale?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Oracle’s bid</a> for a tech partnership and a major equity stake...but everyone’s still waiting on President Trump to approve the agreement. It is a highly unusual situation.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What this means for you </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Midnight on Sunday...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People in the U.S. won’t be able to download TikTok from Apple's or Google's app stores. If you already have TikTok, you’ll be okay...until November 12, when more restrictions hampering functionality will arrive. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WeChat (with about 3.5 million U.S. users) will be gone from the app stores as well. Financial transactions are also <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/18/technology/tiktok-wechat-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">off-limits</a>, meaning American companies won't be able to process WeChat payments from customers and users can't send payments to family members.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Users with the apps already downloaded...</strong>will also face hurdles. New updates will be blocked for U.S. users, which will likely hamper performance.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is Reel serious </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With TikTok in hot Potomac water, Instagram recently debuted a TikTok clone called <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/marketing/stories/2020/08/07/instagram-launches-tiktok-competitor-reels?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reels</a> to capitalize. But yesterday, the head of Instagram Adam Mosseri tweeted that a ban "would be quite bad for Instagram, Facebook, and the internet more broadly." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mosseri adopting an “enemy of my enemy is my friend” approach shows how slippery Big Tech believes this slope to be. President Trump’s heavy-handed intervention in TikTok and WeChat has U.S.-based internet companies <a href="https://www.axios.com/tiktok-calls-for-industry-support-as-it-promises-to-challenge-ban-52f1495d-b718-486d-8c73-f421a58cc4df.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fearing for their own</a> international business aspirations.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Oracle and ByteDance will need to hammer out a deal that satisfies the Trump administration or else a much larger hammer will drop on November 12.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/18/snowflake-headlines-week-red-hot-ipos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Recapping IPO Madness
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Going public via blank check companies (SPACs) has been the Wall Street craze of the summer, but don't forget about good ol’ IPOs—they're having a better year than even bike shorts. Here’s the highlight reel from last week’s public offerings. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Unity Software:</strong> The company whose videogame engine has been used to make mega-popular games <em>Fall Guys</em> and <em>Pokémon Go</em> went public yesterday, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/18/tech/unity-ipo-video-games/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing</a> up 31%. Unity's IPO was unconventional—it used a <a href="https://www.axios.com/unity-ceo-john-riccitiello-explains-his-companys-unusual-ipo-1d5067c8-cfb9-4862-abb9-543c74441eb5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">data-centered approach</a> to price its shares instead of relying on bankers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">JFrog: </strong>The Israel-based software company (ticker: FROG) <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/jfrogs-stock-debuts-with-a-62-leap-above-its-ipo-price-2020-09-16?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped</a> 62% after opening on Thursday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Snowflake: </strong>On Wednesday, the enterprise data analytics firm backed by Warren Buffett became the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/09/18/snowflake-freezing-competition?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest software IPO</a> in history. It's now worth $66 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>If it smells like the 1999 dot-com boom in here, Jay Ritter, a finance professor at the University of Florida, has <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/what-snowflake-and-jfrog-are-telling-us-about-the-ipo-market-now-vs-1999-2020-09-18?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the data</a> to prove your nose correct—the average first-day returns of all IPOs this quarter is higher than any calendar year’s average since...1999.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORLD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/18/israel-implements-second-lockdown-high-holidays?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Lockdown: The Sequel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Israel lockdown" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDU5L2lzcmFlbF9sb2NrZG93bi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>JACK GUEZ/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Israel's government implemented a <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-54201834?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second lockdown</a> yesterday, a three-week curb on movement and economic activity intended to bring down a Covid-19 infection rate that's among the highest in the world.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The lockdown was teed up to coincide with the Jewish High Holidays, when many businesses would be closed anyway. Still, it is highly unpopular.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Israel is believed to be the first developed country to go into a second lockdown, but others may not be far off. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The regional government of Madrid, Spain, is planning a </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-18/madrid-pledges-1-million-tests-to-avoid-disastrous-lockdown?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testing blitz</a></span><span> of 13% of the population (about 1 million people) to prevent another lockdown, which an official said would be an “economic disaster.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the UK, where Covid-19 hospitalizations are rising, the health secretary didn’t rule out another lockdown.</span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F09%2F18%2Fisrael-implements-second-lockdown-high-holidays" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FASHION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/18/fashion-weeks-go-virtual?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Come We Don’t Look This Cool in Masks?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NY Fashion Week models" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDYwL255X2Zhc2hpb25fd2Vla19tb2RlbHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Randy Brooke/WireImage</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York Fashion Week wrapped up its mostly virtual showcases on Thursday. So how’d the fashion industry’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/09/14/nyfw-way-mostly-online?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first foray</a> into pandemic events translate to Instagram? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pros: </strong>With some big-names like Michael Kors sitting out, virtual shows gave younger brands an opportunity to participate in what is a traditionally expensive brand exercise. Some designers got creative, incorporating music, dance, plot, and elaborate sets. And attendees got to trade in heels for slippers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cons: </strong>Sequins don’t sparkle the same on-screen, and brands mostly ditched the in-person schmooze fest with buyers. Host cities are out millions in revenue. Most worryingly, designers have plans for us that don’t involve sweatpants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Up next...London Fashion Week, which Burberry <a href="https://www.cnn.com/style/article/london-fashion-week-september-2020/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicked off</a> yesterday on Twitch with a streamed runway show from a forest. Paris and Milan follow at the end of the month.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The pandemic is expected to drop global luxury sales as much as 35% this year. We’ll be able to better measure the success of September’s fashion weeks after views and distribution deals are counted, Retail Brew writes.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Caption Contest Is Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For a week in August, we took a page from TIME’s 2006 Person of the Year cover and focused on YOU. One particular part of it was a smash hit: the caption contest. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So we’re bringing it back, and the first cartoon (from reader <a href="https://www.instagram.com/bolero.artwork/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Jim Kohl</a>) hits your eyeballs in .01 seconds: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small><em><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDYzL2NhcHRpb25fY29udGVzdF9jcmFiLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></em></small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Jim Kohl</em> </small><small> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it works:</strong> If you have an idea for a funny caption, comment it on our <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CFSz-8Ph-zM/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Instagram</a> or <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1307077183576436748?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter</a>. The person with the funniest caption will get a Morning Brew mug (incalculable value), and the runners-up will be featured in this newsletter next Saturday. Good luck!</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know the animal kingdom can produce some wacky headlines, but whales in particular are bringing the heat this week. Three of these wild whale headlines are real, while one is just a blowhole full of hot air. Can you spot the fake? </p>

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Lost humpback whale </span><span><a href="https://www.livescience.com/humpback-whale-lost-croc-infested-water.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">abandoned by friends</a></span><span> in croc-infested river in Australia”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“5 Beluga whales at </span><span><a href="https://www.newser.com/story/295810/group-sues-us-over-importing-beluga-whales.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">center of lawsuit</a></span><span>”</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Dolphins play ‘</span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/3orieVIDFMj8DEaDzq/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">underwater volleyball</a></span><span>’ with a man’s dropped iPhone”</span>
</li>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNDY2L3J1dGhfYmFkZXJfZ2luc2J1cmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDavid Hume Kennerly/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShe was a presence so towering in our culture she only needed three letters: RBG.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRuth Bader Ginsburg, U.S Supreme Court justice and progressive icon, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/18/us/justice-ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-at-87.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied last night\u003c/a\u003e from complications of metastatic pancreatic cancer. She was 87.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a statement, Chief Justice John Roberts said, “Our Nation has lost a jurist of historic stature,” but that “future generations will remember Ruth Bader Ginsburg as we knew her—a tireless and resolute champion of justice.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSome background\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGinsburg was appointed to the country’s highest court in 1993 by President Clinton, but even before that she had built up a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-18/justice-ginsburg-has-died-u-s-supreme-court-says-kf8vp52t?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereputation\u003c/a\u003e as a fighter for women’s rights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShe was the first female tenured professor at Columbia Law school, and as the director of the ACLU’s Women’s Rights Project, RBG argued sex discrimination cases before the very court she would be appointed to later on. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn the business side, Ginsburg was the court’s most aggressive defender of copyright, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ruth-bader-ginsburg-dies-11600472623?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026tesla=y\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. She picked up the interest from her daughter, Jane, an IP expert at Columbia. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe Notorious R.B.G.\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn her later years, RBG earned rock-star status among progressives for her fierce commitment to liberal principles. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYou may have seen a few recent films about her: \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.rbgmovie.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eRBG\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4669788/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn the Basis of Sex\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eShe’s been \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2018/05/01/rbg-documentary-shows-how-ruth-bader-ginsburg-became-pop-icon/562930002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eportrayed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in countless memes, t-shirts, and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eSNL \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eskits—can't say the same of most Supreme Court justices. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGinsburg’s death has profound implications for U.S. politics. President Trump and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell will race to add a conservative justice to the court to pad their existing advantage, despite McConnell refusing to consider an Obama Supreme Court nominee in 2016 because it was an election year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn a statement released last night, McConnell said, “President Trump’s nominee will receive a vote on the floor of the United States Senate.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s not what RBG had in mind. In a statement dictated to her granddaughter a few days ago, she said, \"My most fervent wish is that I will not be replaced until a new president is installed,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/09/18/100306972/justice-ruth-bader-ginsburg-champion-of-gender-equality-dies-at-87?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to NPR\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eGinsburg’s death, while heartbreaking to many Americans, will also serve as a call-to-action 45 days ahead of the election.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" TikTok\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Black Friday rush\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=503 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/11iAbnnYIgFMmQ/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Black Friday rush\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/11iAbnnYIgFMmQ/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Commerce Department said it will not allow TikTok or WeChat to appear on app stores in the U.S. after 11:59pm on Sunday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eTikTok seemed to be out of the dog house earlier this week when ByteDance accepted \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/14/oracletiktok-deal-partnership-less-sale?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOracle’s bid\u003c/a\u003e for a tech partnership and a major equity stake...but everyone’s still waiting on President Trump to approve the agreement. It is a highly unusual situation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat this means for you \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMidnight on Sunday...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePeople in the U.S. won’t be able to download TikTok from Apple's or Google's app stores. If you already have TikTok, you’ll be okay...until November 12, when more restrictions hampering functionality will arrive. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWeChat (with about 3.5 million U.S. users) will be gone from the app stores as well. Financial transactions are also \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/18/technology/tiktok-wechat-ban.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoff-limits\u003c/a\u003e, meaning American companies won't be able to process WeChat payments from customers and users can't send payments to family members.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUsers with the apps already downloaded...\u003c/strong\u003ewill also face hurdles. New updates will be blocked for U.S. users, which will likely hamper performance.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is Reel serious \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith TikTok in hot Potomac water, Instagram recently debuted a TikTok clone called \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/marketing/stories/2020/08/07/instagram-launches-tiktok-competitor-reels?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReels\u003c/a\u003e to capitalize. But yesterday, the head of Instagram Adam Mosseri tweeted that a ban \"would be quite bad for Instagram, Facebook, and the internet more broadly.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMosseri adopting an “enemy of my enemy is my friend” approach shows how slippery Big Tech believes this slope to be. President Trump’s heavy-handed intervention in TikTok and WeChat has U.S.-based internet companies \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/tiktok-calls-for-industry-support-as-it-promises-to-challenge-ban-52f1495d-b718-486d-8c73-f421a58cc4df.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efearing for their own\u003c/a\u003e international business aspirations.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eOracle and ByteDance will need to hammer out a deal that satisfies the Trump administration or else a much larger hammer will drop on November 12.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGoing public via blank check companies (SPACs) has been the Wall Street craze of the summer, but don't forget about good ol’ IPOs—they're having a better year than even bike shorts. Here’s the highlight reel from last week’s public offerings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnity Software:\u003c/strong\u003e The company whose videogame engine has been used to make mega-popular games \u003cem\u003eFall Guys\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003ePokémon Go\u003c/em\u003e went public yesterday, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/18/tech/unity-ipo-video-games/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosing\u003c/a\u003e up 31%. Unity's IPO was unconventional—it used a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/unity-ceo-john-riccitiello-explains-his-companys-unusual-ipo-1d5067c8-cfb9-4862-abb9-543c74441eb5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edata-centered approach\u003c/a\u003e to price its shares instead of relying on bankers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJFrog: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Israel-based software company (ticker: FROG) \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/jfrogs-stock-debuts-with-a-62-leap-above-its-ipo-price-2020-09-16?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumped\u003c/a\u003e 62% after opening on Thursday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSnowflake: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Wednesday, the enterprise data analytics firm backed by Warren Buffett became the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/09/18/snowflake-freezing-competition?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest software IPO\u003c/a\u003e in history. It's now worth $66 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eIf it smells like the 1999 dot-com boom in here, Jay Ritter, a finance professor at the University of Florida, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/what-snowflake-and-jfrog-are-telling-us-about-the-ipo-market-now-vs-1999-2020-09-18?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe data\u003c/a\u003e to prove your nose correct—the average first-day returns of all IPOs this quarter is higher than out:\u003c/strong\u003e Israel is believed to be the first developed country to go into a second lockdown, but others may not be far off. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe regional government of Madrid, Spain, is planning a collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York Fashion Week wrapped up its mostly virtual showcases on Thursday. So how’d the fashion industry’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/09/14/nyfw-way-mostly-online?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst foray\u003c/a\u003e into pandemic events translate to Instagram? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePros: \u003c/strong\u003eWith some big-names like Michael Kors sitting out, virtual shows gave younger brands an opportunity to participate in what is a traditionally expensive brand exercise. Some designers got creative, incorporating music, dance, plot, and elaborate sets. And attendees got to trade in heels for slippers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCons: \u003c/strong\u003eSequins don’t sparkle the same on-screen, and brands mostly ditched the in-person schmooze fest with buyers. Host cities are out millions in revenue. Most worryingly, designers have plans for us that don’t involve sweatpants. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUp next...London Fashion Week, which Burberry \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/style/article/london-fashion-week-september-2020/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicked off\u003c/a\u003e yesterday on Twitch with a streamed runway show from a forest. Paris and Milan follow at the end of the month.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe pandemic is expected to drop global luxury sales as much as 35% this year.
